SENT.plain: The antiphospholipid antibody syndrome may be associated with connective tissue disorders
We describe a patient with catastrophic antiphospholipid antibody syndrome secondary to systemic lupus erythematosus who presented with recurrent abdominal symptoms
Our patient died, and autopsy revealed hemorrhagic infarction of bowel with numerous mesenteric hemorrhages
The treatment for antiphospholipid antibody syndrome ranges from aspirin, warfarin, and plasmapheresis to prednisone and hydroxychloroquine
